results.title: The management of work centres for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: Francis Haveron, United Motion Pictures, Heron Film Productions and Michael Holmes
results.brief_description: Describes the process of management through the management committee, the work centre manager and his staff. It shows work produced by physically handicapped workers which includes packing, assembling wire products, various machine operations and handicrafts.

results.title: The Man, the snake and the fox
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatization of a traditional Ojibwa legend; it is told to a group of children from the Wandereing Spirit Survival School. As the story unfolds, the characters played by puppets assume increasingly human characteristics. The moral of the fable: do not make promises that cannot be kept.

results.title: The Man you loved to hate
results.brief_description: A career biography of one of Hollywoods most flamboyant showmen, Erich Von Stroheim. Film clips, interviews, and excerpts from thirty Von Stroheim films are used to reconstruct a portrait of the man behind the legend.

results.title: The Man you know
results.creator_credit: Beth McRae, McRae Saunders Productions, Australian Film Commission and Steve Jacobs
results.brief_description: A strange and unusual film about one man’s struggle for identity, his alienation with the world of today and his attempts to remain shut off from all that is offensive and intrusive, and yet which eventually leads him on a frenetic search amongst his books, magazines and photographs for Bob Proudfoot, “The man you know”. Using photographic images, newspaper articles, background voices and narration, this satirical experimental film attacks just about all areas that were once considered taboo, or not open for discussion, in Australia - politics, religion, sex, family life. Cast includes Lance Curtis as the young man and Steve Jacobs as the voice of Bob Proudfoot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beth McRae, McRae Saunders Productions, Australian Film Commission and Steve Jacobs

results.title: The Man with the movie camera = Chelovek s kinoapparatom
results.brief_description: Writer/Director/Editor, Dziga-Vertov, was made Head of the Cinema Department of the All Russian Central Executive at the age of 22. His film shows all the tricks of which the camera is capable. Vertov shows Russia as it really is; indeed, the final impact of the film arises from a feeling of participation in life itself as we share the unique vision of the camera-eye.
results.title_for_label: The Man with the movie camera = Chelovek s kinoapparatom

results.title: The Man with a movie camera: fragments from a cameraman's diary
results.brief_description:
The film’s protagonist is a cameraman travelling through the city involving himself in its daily dawn-to-dusk activities and observing all walks of life through the eye of his camera. Although Vertov’s film has been linked with the so-called ‘city symphonies’, Vertov is not concerned with the abstract formalism of films like Berlin but with a philosophical reflection on the power of the camera over ‘reality’. Vertov rejected the contemporary fiction film in favour of recording unstaged ‘reality’, what he called ‘instants of life’. Yet his concern was also with the nature of cinematographic illusion. He constantly reminds the audience of the camera’s presence and of the film being edited and screened. As such his influence extends across the filmmaking spectrum from cinema verite’s preoccupation with unstaged reality to experimental self-reflexiveness and the preoccupation of filmmakers like Godard with the ideology of representation. Also available on 16mm and VHS.

Credits: Director, script, Dziga Vertov ; photographer, Mikhail Kaufman.

results.title: The Man who thought with his hat (K)
results.brief_description: The amusing, satirical story of Alec Noll, President of Agonia. He was such an important man, but with one strange characteristic…he thought with his hat. Based on a book by Swedish writer, Gunnar Berefelt.

results.title: The Man who stops accidents
results.creator_credit: Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: Although most managements take precautions to prevent foreseeable accidents, they are still common, a very large percentage being caused by personal carelessness. In this film, the duties of the foreman in accident prevention are stressed. It goes on to show a series of “typical” accidents and “puts the clock back” on them to show how they could have been prevented.

results.title: The Man who stole Uganda
results.creator_credit: John Sheppard and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Uganda’s General Milton Obote was deposed by his own army. It took Major General Idi Amin, self-appointed Head of Army and State, just one week to take charge of key services and installations. Behind this well-organised takeover lies a history of military corruption.

results.title: The Man who skied Antarctica
results.brief_description: Yuichiro Miura, the man who skied down Everest, seeks self-discovery on an Antarctic peak where he encounters storm, crevasse and avalanche. A gripping metaphor of challenge and supreme human perseverance.
